alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:53PM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Morris, Essex and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Chatham, Little Falls, Millington, Pine Brook, Singac...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. At 20.0 feet, Eagle Rock Avenue in Roseland is subject to flooding. Camp Lane Road, River Edge Drive and Broadway Lane in Fairfield are flooded. Stewart Place is closed. At 20.5 feet, Bloomfield Avenue in West Caldwell floods. Matt Drive, Brook Street and Oak Road in Fairfield are flooded and subject to closures. At 21.0 feet, Widespread flooding in Fairfield, including Bloomfield Avenue. Residences between Route 80 and Route 46 flood. Route 46 East in Wayne is shut down. Commercial properties on Bloomfield Avenue in West Caldwell are flooded. At 22.0 feet, Flooding stretches up to the southern portions on Montville. Lower Hook Mountain Road is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 20.2 feet. - The river rose above flood stage early Wednesday morning, and continued to rise above moderate flood stage Wednesday evening. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.3 feet early Friday morning. However, with additional rainfall forecast Friday night, the river will not fall much before rising again, to near 22.3 feet Saturday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.3 feet on 03/16/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 20.2 Wed 9 pm 21.2 21.1 21.3 1am 1/12 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
